summary: A Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 10, 2019, detailing a supervised social phone call made by inmate Jeffrey Epstein to his mother on the evening of August 9, 2019. The document records the logistics of the call, including escort, location, and duration.

events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was escorted to the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and allowed to make a 15-minute social phone call, which he stated was to his mother.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York under registration number 76318-054 as of August 2019.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein was allowed a supervised 15-minute social phone call, which he stated was to his mother.
The call was facilitated by a Unit Manager who escorted Epstein to the Special Housing Unit (G Tier) and provided a phone.
Epstein indicated he did not have his phone account (Poe and Pin number) set up, so the staff member dialed a number beginning with area code 347.
This administrative memo documents routine prison activity the day before Epstein was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019.
